title: As BOC, I want Option days to not account for Post game assignments
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as Club or BOC
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a player on Optional Assignment with the Post Game Assignment checkbox checked
custom_expected: THEN he does not get an Option day for the date of the transaction

title: As BOC, I do not want player to get an option day on the date he is recalled
custom_steps:
**AC**
- If player  has a Recall transaction, then he does not get an Option day for the date of the transaction

title: As BOC, I want option days to account for DFA roster status
custom_steps:
**AC**
- If player's roster status is DFA, then look at his previous roster status. If his previous status was Optioned, then only his first DFA day counts as an Option day. (Per EBISII-13173)

title: A Club/BOC, I want to see Option and Outright info from ebis 1 in ebis 2
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=transactions

**AC**
- Add the Transactions tab to the player profile
- Build the Outrights and Options collapsible sections (expanded by default)
- Info from ebis 1 should be populated in the corresponding fields in ebis 2
- Note that "Outright Days - Current Season" has been removed as a field
- The Prior Outright field will show either "No"or the date of the prior outright if there was one.

title: As BOC, I want to calculate Option days for a player
custom_steps:
- If player's MJ Roster status is 'Optioned' at any point during the day, that day counts as an Option day
- Keep track of how many total Option days the player had in the current season. If player is currently on Option, count the # of days in his current assignment
- Populate the "Option Day" column on the 'Breakdown' section of a player's service page. This should count up similar to 'MJ Day' column
- Update the 'Option Days - Current Season' and 'Option Days - Current Assignment' fields on the transaction tab.

title: As BOC, I want to track Outright days for a player
custom_steps:
**AC**
- Once a Major/Minor Outright has been approved for a player, we start counting outright days from the date of the transaction. The only roster status that is valid for earning an outright day is a null/blank major league roster status
- Outright Days will stop accumulating and no longer display a value once a player joins a major league club, leaves the Org completely or at the end of the year. If a player is again approved for a Major/Minor Outright, the accumulation can continue.  The Outright days will stop counting up when the end of the MN club season is reached. 
- The day he gains a Major league roster status does not count toward an Outright day.
- If player  has an Major/Minor Outright with Post Game Assignment checkbox checked, then he does not get an Outright day for the date of the transaction
- Populate the "Outright Days - Current Assignment" field with the updated value
- Populate the "Outright Day" column on the 'Breakdown' section of a player's service page. This should count up similar to 'MJ Day' column

title: As BOC, I want the Option / Outright days to be counted automatically every night
custom_steps:
**AC**
- If the player qualifies for Option/Outright/DL day for the upcoming day based on his current MJ roster status, then tick up his MJ service automatically after midnight

title: As a Club/BOC, I want to see a player's prior outright date
custom_steps:
**AC**
- The "prior outright date" on the transaction tab of player profile should be populated correctly with the date of the first time the player was outrighted

title: As BOC, I want to calculate DL days for a player
custom_steps:
**AC**
- If player's MJ Roster status is one of the below at any point during the day, that day counts as a DL day
7DC â€“ 7 Day Concussion DL
7CR â€“ Rehab 7 Day Concussion DL
15D â€“ 15 Day DL
15R â€“ Rehab 15 Day DL
60D â€“ 60 Day DL
60R â€“ Rehab 60 Day DL
- Keep track of how many total DL days the player had in the current season. If player is currently on DL, count the # of days in his current assignment. When player is no longer on DL, reset the current assignment value
- Populate the "DL Day" column on the 'Breakdown' section of a player's service page. This should count up similar to 'MJ Day' column
- Update the 'Days on DL - Current Season' and 'Days on DL - Current Assignment' fields on the transaction tab.

title: CBA: As BOC, I do not want players to receive Service when suspended for Drug use
custom_steps: WHEN a player is on the Restricted List with Reason "Violation of Major League Drug Testing Program"
custom_expected:
THEN they should no longer get a day of service (per the new CBA)

Note:
- See #120768087 where this exception was originally implemented. This exception should now no longer apply

title: As BOC, I want to know when a player reaches his 3 yr milestone
custom_steps:
**AC**
- When a player earns 3 years of MLS, the 3 year milestone is crossed. 
- If player reaches 3 Year milestone, populate the date on the service tab of his profile.
  *Note: For older players, like Justin Verlander and Mike Trout, you will see just a "Yes" indicating that the milestone was reached.  More recent players will display the date the milestone is reached*

title: As BOC, I want to know when a player reaches his 5 yr and 6 yr milestone
custom_steps:
**AC**
- When a player earns 5/6 years of MLS, the 5/6 year milestone is crossed. 
- If player reaches 5/6 Year milestone, populate the date on the service tab of his profile.

title: As BOC, I want to project when a player will reach his milestones
custom_steps:
**AC**
- To project the 3 yr, 5 yr, 6 yr and 10/5 yr date, we make the assumption that player will get a day of service for every remaining day of the rest of the current season (up to and including Last Day of Season in system dates)
- Based on this assumption, if the player will reach his 3 yr, 5 yr, 6 yr or 10/5 yr date within the current season, show "Projected - mm/dd/yyyy" with the future date on which player will reach the milestone in the Service tab
- If the player cannot reach the milestone within the season, then leave the fields blank on the service tab

title: As BOC, I want to know when a player reaches his 10/5 milestone
custom_steps:
**AC**
- The 10/5 year milestone is reached when a player earns 10 years of MLS total AND 5 years of MLS consecutive with the current team that he is on.
- If player leaves the team (released or FA), or becomes voluntarily retired, deceased or unconditionally released, this date gets cleared from the service page (but not reset in the backend)
- If the player signs with another Major league team, this milestone gets completely reset
- If the player moves around to the minor leagues with the same ORG or re-signs with the same Org, the milestone continues from where it left off
- If player reaches 10/5 Year milestone, populate the date on the service tab of his profile.
- If player is traded, player's 10/5 milestone is reset

title: As club/BOC, I can see when player has or will cross his service milestone values
custom_steps:
**Wire**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
 - Historical service milestone data from ebis 1 is populated in ebis 2 in the Milestones section of the Service tab of player profile
- If the milestone is a projected date, this value should also display in this section
- 10/5 date should not blank out when not in season
- In cases where we do not have the date because it could not be ETL'd from ebis 1, we will just show "Yes" when milestone was reached

title: As BOC, I do not want a player to get service credit for more than 172 days per season
custom_steps:
**AC**
- This is calculated as part of the Major League Service Batch
- Current Service service cannot exceed 172 days per season. 
- Once the player reaches 172 days, player no longer gets a day of service for the current season

title: As BOC, I only want service calculations to start after Roster Submission time on Opening Day
custom_steps:
**AC**
- When calculating service for Opening Day, only begin to check for Service accruing roster statuses after "Opening Day Roster submission deadline" time (set in System dates). This also applies to clubs with Early Openers
- If player had a service accruing roster status before the submission time but did not have a service roster status after the submission time, player does not get service for that day
- To get the time of the transaction, use the time of submission of TX.

title: As BOC, I want to give players a day of service when he has a service accruing roster status
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=all_batches
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contrat_expiration (general example)

**AC**
- The Pro Roster Batch can now be run in Test, Report, and Update mode


**Work performed by batch**
- On the population of players identified in #121619895, the batch should calculate "Current Season Service" in days.
- The current season begins with Opening Day (System date) until current day or Last day of season (system date), whichever is earlier. Use Club System dates for this (Some clubs may have early openers)
- For each day of the season, including the first and last day, if the player had a roster accruing status at any point during the day, he gets one day of service for that day. 
- The "Current Season Service" days is the number of days he has gotten service in the current season including today (day batch is run) if applicable
- Once the batch has been run, update the "Current Season Service" field on the player profile with the updated value in days. Eg. 62 days


**Roster Accruing statuses**
DFA â€“ Designated for Assignment (exceptions covered later)
15D â€“ 15 Day DL
15R â€“ Rehab 15 Day DL
7DC â€“ 7 Day Concussion DL
7CR â€“ Rehab 7 Day Concussion DL
60D â€“ 60 Day DL
60R â€“ Rehab 60 Day DL
BRV â€“ Bereavement List
PTR â€“ Paternity List
MIL â€“ Military Leave
ACT â€“ Active
PND â€“ Active pending contract
SUS â€“ Suspended
RES â€“ Restricted (exceptions covered later)

**Columns for Results table:**
Player ID
Name
Org
Club
Roster Status

**Global**
- Batch can be aborted
- Show progress bar when processing
- Any errors are returned in results
- Previous batch results can be viewed
- Batch can be run in Test mode where the batch changes can be reversed
- Batch can be run in Update mode where they are actually changed

title: As BOC, I want the current year MJ service summary to get updated daily
custom_steps:
**AC**
- This is done as part of the MJ Service calculation batch.
- Populate the Major League summary table with the most current information for current season rows when the service batch is run
- If player has switched Orgs, each Org gets it's own row for that year
- "Days with Club" is the total # of days player spent with the club irrespective of whether he got service or not. If a player was traded, the "To" club gets service credit for that day
- 'Days toward 172' is how many days with this club counted towards service upto a max of 172
- Total Season service is the total # of service days this season irrespective of Org. Only the row for his most recent Org is populated.
- Total MLS is his total current MLS for this current season. For rows with previous Orgs, populate with the MLS that the player left the Org with

title: As Club/BOC, I do not want to see MJ service section for players who have never played in the MJ leagues
custom_steps:
**AC**
- If player has never played in the Major leagues, hide the following sections on the Service tab

Service Info
- Major League Service 
- Milestones section

Major League Summary

title: As BOC, I want player to get service if he was DFA from a service accruing status
custom_steps:
**AC**
- This is calculated as part of the Major League Service Batch
- When considering the service accruing status "DFA" to give player service, check the player's previous Roster status before becoming DFA. 
- Only give service to the player for each day he was DFA if the previous roster status was a service accruing status. If his previous roster status was not service accruing, the player does not qualify for service for the days he was DFA unless he has another service accruing roster status on that day

title: As BOC, I want a player who was traded to get service with his destination club
custom_steps:
**AC**
- This is calculated as part of the Major League Service Batch
- On days where the player was part of Multiple Orgs in the same day (eg. during a trade), check if player had a service accruing roster status after the Org Change. If so then the credit for that Service day goes to the "to" Org.
- If player did not have a roster accruing status after the Org change but had a roster accruing status before the Org change, then the credit goes to the "From" org.

title: As BOC, I want to see a player's service days with his current club
custom_steps:
**AC**
- Player's current club MLS is the player's MLS with the Org that is he currently associated with shown in the XX.YYY format.
- This value is also capped at 172 days per season even if player was traded during the year
- If player was with the same ORG from previous seasons, then this value is the current season service added to the previous season service with that same Org.
- Updated value should show on the Player profile service tab

title: As BOC, I can see a day by day breakdown of player's MJ service
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
- For all pro players, add the section "Breakdown" as per wire
- The year dropdown is set to current year. We will only start keeping breakdown history from the year Ebis 2.5 goes live
- Do now show "Type of Service" filter dropdown as this will not be implemented before go-live
- Table is not editable

Show table with following columns (other columns implemented later and should not be added to page)
- Date - Show a row for every date starting from Opening day to Last day of season. Most recent on top
- MJ Roster Status EOD - MJ Roster status for the player at the end of each of those days
- Org EOD - Org of player at end of each date
- MJ service - Check mark if player got service that day.  Blank otherwise
- MJ Day - Start count of service day so 1st day of service would be 1, 2nd day is 2 etc.

**Note**
Even though this feature is not in ebis 1, this will be a huge time-saver with testing in addition to providing a lot of business value and therefore has a worthwhile return on investment

title: As BOC, I want Major League service to be given to player automatically every night
custom_steps:
**AC**
- If the player qualifies for service for the upcoming day based on his current Major league roster status, then tick up his MJ service automatically after midnight

title: As BOC, I want to see a yearly summary of MJ Service on the player's profile from ebis 1
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
- On the player profile service tab, add the Major League Summary section as a collapsible section to the page. It should be expanded by default.
- Bring over all Service history from ebis 1 and display in this section.
- When player has played for multiple Orgs in the same year, each Org has it's own row for that year.
- Note that in ebis 1, Adjustments was split up into Option days, strike days and Misc days. In Ebis 2, this is combined into one adjustments field which is the sum of the 3 values in ebis 1
- Any comments entered in ebis 1 should show in bubble format in ebis 2

title: As BOC, I want to see a day by day breakdown of player's Minor League service days
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
In the Breakdown widget on the Service tab, add the following 4 columns. 
- MN Roster Status EOD
- Club EOD (minor league club at end of day if any)
- Mnr Service (LOP at which player got service credit)
- Mnr Day (ticks up with each day of Mnr service)

title: Update the MN Contracts Yrs and MN Service Yrs fields on the player header
custom_steps:
**AC**
- The "MN Contract yrs" and MN Service Yrs" field on the player profile secondary header should be populated with the same values in the Service Tab

title: As BOC, I want to calculate a player's Minor League service days
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
- For each day of the season, including the first and last day, if the player had a roster accruing minor league status at any point during the day, he gets one day of MN service.
**Roster Accruing statuses**
7DL â€“ 7 Day DL
7RH â€“ Rehab 7 Day DL
60D â€“ 60 Day DL
60R â€“ Rehab 60 Day DL
ACT â€“ Active
TI - Temporarily Inactive

- Each minor league club has it's own start date and end date in the Club system dates screen. Use the player's MN club at EOD for each day to determine if that day is in season or not. Do not include post season. 
- If player was in multiple MN clubs on the same day, the credit goes to the last MN club that he finished with.
- If player already got Major league service for that day, then player cannot get Minor league service for the same day.
- Update the "Current Season Service" field under the Minor League Service section of the Service tab
- Update the current year row in the Minor League Summary table in the Service tab

title: As BOC, I want to see a yearly summary of Minor Service on the player's profile from ebis 1
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
- On the player profile service tab, add the Minor League Summary section as a collapsible section to the page. It should be expanded by default.
- Bring over all Minor lg Service history from ebis 1 and display in this section. 
- The Contract Year column, Service Year column and Foreign Year column are OUT OF SCOPE for go-live. All other columns in the table should be populated with data from ebis 1
- When player has played for multiple Orgs in the same year, each Org has it's own row for that year. 

**Note**
- Dev and QA will need to figure out how to test and data validate this since ebis 1 does not have a front-end for this information

title: As BOC, I want the Minor League Service to be given to player automatically every night
custom_steps:
**AC**

- If the player qualifies for service for the upcoming day based on his current minor league roster status, then tick up his MN service automatically after midnight

title: As BOC, I want to see a player's total MLS
custom_steps:
**AC**
- This is calculated as part of the Major League Service Batch
- Using the "Current Season Service" value, update the player's Total MLS on the service tab on his player profile and the player header.
- To get the total MLS, add the Current season MLS to Prior season MLS.
- Major League Service is displayed as "XX.YYY"; "X" is the full season year while "YYY" is the number of days in the current season. A player earns a full season by accruing 172 days of Major League Service.  For example, "1.105" means that a player have  one full year (172 days) plus 105 days of Major League Service.
- XX will increment once YYY reaches 171.  For example, if a player is at 1.171, the next value would be 2.000.

title: As BOC, I want to see basic service info on the player profile (info from ebis 1)
custom_steps:
**Intro**
Major League Service is displayed as "XX.YYY"; "X" is the full season year while "YYY" is the number of days in the current season. A player earns a full season by accruing 171 days of Major League Service.  For example, "1.105" means that a player have  one full year and 105 days of Major League Service.
XX will increment once YYY reaches 171.  For example, if a player is at 1.171, the next value would be 2.000.
The number of days on club a player can actually earn in a given year is greater than 172, 172 is the max value though as far as the service calculation goes.
A player can only earn a maximum of 1 service year per calendar year

**Wire**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
- Build the Service Info subsection of the Service tab as shown in wireframe
- "Super 2" comes from "Super Two year" in ebis 1 (general info section).
- Rookie Milestone Crossed info comes from ebis 1 general info section. If field is left blank in ebis 2, it means milestone was not yet crossed so player is currently a rookie.
- For this story, in the "Misc" session, the "Year Add C excluded from FA" and "DL Exclusion Year" fields can be ignored and should not be added to the page yet
- Under the "Minor League Service" section, "Current Season Service" is a new field so does not need to be populated for this story
- "Potential Minor Lg FA", "Minor Lg FA Yr" and "Highest Level of play" have already been implemented but should be moved to their correct updated location.
- Service Info is expanded by default but can be collapsed
- All fields should be populated with equivalent data from ebis 1
- Service info in service tab must match the service info in the player header

**Note to QA**
Please do some basic data validation (check at least 10 profiles with MJ service)

title: As BOC, I want player flagged a rookie until he has 45 Active roster days
custom_steps:
**AC**
- The rookie milestone date is reached by either a service based check, or a statistics based check â€“ whichever occurs first. For this story, only implement the service check 
- The player is no longer a rookie when the player is on the 25-man roster for a total of 45 days before and not including 'Roster expansion' date (system date)
- Roster statuses that count toward 25 man are Active, Active Pending Contract, Suspended (by League) and Suspended (by League)/Assigned. Note that on the front end, all the Suspended statuses show the same
- The requirement can be earned over multiple seasons. For example 20 days can be earned in the 2015 season and the remaining 25 days can be earned in the 2016 season
- If player reaches rookie milestone, populate the date on the service tab of his profile.

title: As BOC, I want player to be flagged rookie until he reaches at-bats of 130 or pitched 50 innings
custom_steps:
**AC**
- The rookie milestone date is reached by either a service based check (see #120769117) , or a statistics based check â€“ whichever occurs first.
- The rookie milestone date is the date when a player reaches his cumulative major league at-bats of 130 or innings pitched of 50, if this occurs before the service based check
- The requirement can be earned over multiple seasons. 
- If player reaches rookie milestone using this check, populate the date on the service tab of his profile.

title: As BOC, I want to manually add a year to MJ Summary
custom_steps:
**Wireframe:**
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service

**AC**
- The MJ Summary has an 'Add Row' option
- When a row is added, the Year, Club, Days w Club, Adjustments and Comments columns become editable. Other columns stay uneditable
- The year dropdown only let's you select a year starting from 2004 up until the year of the last or current season. Additionally only show years that do not already have a row in the table. If the player already has a row for every year since 2004 until now, then the dropdown is blank.
- User can select the Org and enter a number value for Days w Club and Adjustments. 
- On Saving, treat the newly added row just like any other historical service record and adjust the service calculation accordingly. Also rearrange the newly added row chronologically
- Note that if a manual record was entered for the current year, and if the system finds that he has service for the current year, the manual record can be overwritten by the system.

title: As BOC, I can set a player's Super 2 year
custom_steps:
**AC**
- When the player hits "Edit" on the Service tab of the player profile, the Super 2 year field becomes editable.
- The Super 2 year field is a dropdown, blank by default and shows values up to 3 years before and 3 years after the current year
- The user can pick a year and save it to the profile
- Users with player profile edit permission on the BOC side can edit this field

title: As BOC, I want only certain users to have permission to manually adjust service
custom_steps:
**AC**
- Ability to adjust service is a special permission that is granted to only a certain set of BOC users. Any user without this permission does not see the pencil icons and ADD ROW button on this widget
